title: Output Shaft - Disassembly

body.body: Removing the output shaft bearing from the shaft will damage the bearing and snap ring. Never reuse removed bearings or snap rings as use of damaged or weakened components could lead to engine and transmission damage.
The numbers in brackets in the following text refer to the output shaft exploded view below.
Splined thrust washer (46 mm outside diameter)
Collect the output shaft seal (25) and the circlip (24).
Remove the output shaft bearing (1 and 2), the snap ring (3) and thrust washer (4). Discard the snap ring.
Mark one side of first gear to denote its correct orientation. Remove first gear (5) from the shaft, complete with the split needle roller bearing (6) which runs inside the gear.
Mark one side of fifth gear to denote its correct orientation. Remove fifth gear (8) from the shaft.
Remove the snap ring (9), splined thrust washer, locking outer (10) and the splined thrust washer, locking inner (11) from in front of third gear. Discard the snap ring.
Mark one side of third gear to denote its correct orientation. Remove third gear (12) complete with the split needle roller bearing which runs inside the gear (13).
Mark one side of fourth gear to denote its correct orientation. Remove fourth gear (14) complete with the split needle roller bearing (15) which runs inside the gear.
Mark one side of sixth gear to denote its correct orientation. Remove sixth gear (16) from the shaft.
Remove the snap ring (17) and the splined thrust washer (18) from in front of second gear. Discard the snap ring.
Mark one side of second gear to denote its correct orientation. Remove second gear (19) complete with the split needle roller bearing (20) which runs inside the gear.

When using a press, always wear overalls, eye, face and hand protection. Objects such as bearings frequently break-up under load and the debris caused during break-up may cause damage and injury to unprotected parts of the body.
Never wear loose clothing, which could become trapped in the press and cause crushing injuries to the hand, arms or other parts of the anatomy.
If required, support the bearing (22) on press bars, then press the shaft (21) through the bearing and sprocket spacer (23).
Discard the main bearing and spacer.
